abstract: Until today, the latest sell-off in the stock market had not reflected the panic of early July, when some banks were trading as if the end was near. The Standard & Poor’s index of the financials in the S.&P. 500 rose 3 percent in the first two trading days of the week, while the overall market was falling.
lead_paragraph: Until today, the latest sell-off in the stock market had not reflected the panic of early July, when some banks were trading as if the end was near. The Standard & Poor’s index of the financials in the S.&P. 500 rose 3 percent in the first two trading days of the week, while the overall market was falling.

headline.main: A Whiff of Panic Returns to Wall Street
